name: Floyd
summary: Designs and manufactures adaptable furniture for modern living.
verdict: Parts are sourced from the US and globally, with primary manufacturing and assembly in the United States.

name: Herman Miller
summary: Iconic American company famous for high-performance office chairs.
verdict: Vast majority of products for the North American market are manufactured in Michigan.

name: Room & Board
summary: Retailer of modern furniture. Over 90% manufactured in the US.
verdict: Strong commitment to American manufacturing, partnering with numerous domestic workshops.

name: La-Z-Boy
summary: Famous for inventing the recliner, a household name for comfort.
verdict: Operates several manufacturing plants in the US but sources components both domestically and globally.

name: Polywood
summary: Creates durable, all-weather outdoor furniture from recycled plastics.
verdict: A clear example of 'Made in USA.' The entire process happens in their US facilities.

name: Vaughan-Bassett
summary: The largest manufacturer of wooden adult bedroom furniture in the US.
verdict: Employs hundreds in its Virginia plants, using timber from the American Southeast.

name: IKEA
summary: Swedish multinational that sells ready-to-assemble furniture.
verdict: Products are sourced from a massive global supply chain. Not a 'Made in USA' brand.

name: West Elm
summary: A brand focused on modern design. Part of the Williams-Sonoma portfolio.
verdict: Owned by a US company. A significant portion of their main product line is manufactured overseas.

name: Steelcase
summary: A leading manufacturer of office furniture and architectural products.
verdict: With a large manufacturing footprint in the US, particularly in Michigan, Steelcase is a prime example of American manufacturing.

name: Ashley Furniture
summary: One of the largest furniture manufacturers in the world.
verdict: Operates a global supply chain with many products and components imported from countries like China and Vietnam.

name: Fiesta Tableware
summary: Iconic, colorful, and durable ceramic dinnerware since 1936.
verdict: Fiesta dinnerware is 100% made in the USA at the Homer Laughlin China Company's plant in Newell, West Virginia.

name: American Giant
summary: High-quality, durable clothing famous for their heavyweight hoodies.
verdict: Committed to US manufacturing, with cotton grown and sewn in the Carolinas, and all production within the United States.

name: Estwing
summary: A leading American manufacturer of hammers, axes, and specialty tools.
verdict: Estwing tools are proudly manufactured in Rockford, Illinois, as they have been since 1923.

name: Darn Tough Vermont
summary: Family-owned company making premium performance socks.
verdict: All socks are designed, tested, and manufactured in Northfield, Vermont, embodying a strong commitment to local production.

name: L.L.Bean
summary: Iconic retailer of outdoor gear, famous for its Bean Boots.
verdict: While many products are globally sourced, L.L.Bean maintains a significant US manufacturing presence, particularly at its Brunswick, Maine facility.

name: New Balance (Made in USA)
summary: Major athletic footwear brand with a dedicated line of US-made sneakers.
verdict: New Balance is unique among major sneaker brands for its commitment to domestic manufacturing for its 'Made in USA' collection.

name: Wiffle Ball, Inc.
summary: The iconic plastic ball and bat, a staple of backyard fun.
verdict: A true American classic, every Wiffle Ball and bat is produced at their single factory in Shelton, Connecticut.

name: Peterboro Basket Company
summary: One of the oldest basket manufacturers in the US, handcrafting high-quality baskets.
verdict: All baskets are handcrafted from American-grown Appalachian White Ash wood in their Peterborough, New Hampshire facility.

name: Alex and Ani
summary: Known for its expandable charm bracelets, jewelry, and accessories.
verdict: The company proudly states that its jewelry is designed and crafted in Rhode Island, supporting local artisans.

name: Timberland
summary: Globally recognized brand for rugged outdoor boots and apparel.
verdict: While headquartered in the US, the vast majority of Timberland's manufacturing now occurs overseas. Some specialized lines may have US assembly.

name: Origin Maine
summary: Manufactures functional and durable goods from jeans to supplements.
verdict: A model of vertical integration, Origin Maine controls its entire supply chain from its Maine-based factory.

name: Vermont Flannel Company
summary: Specializes in soft, high-quality flannel clothing.
verdict: All products are handcrafted and sewn in the USA, with a strong connection to their home state of Vermont.

name: New England Shirt Company
summary: Creates ready-to-wear and custom shirts in a historic MA factory.
verdict: As America's oldest ready-to-wear shirt manufacturer, every shirt is cut and sewn in their Fall River, MA factory.

name: All American Clothing Co.
summary: Offers a wide range of clothing, from jeans to outerwear.
verdict: A strong advocate for domestic manufacturing, tracing materials and labor to ensure every product meets their 'All American' standard.

name: Gitman Bros.
summary: A heritage brand known for its impeccably crafted men's dress shirts.
verdict: Remaining one of the few American shirtmakers, Gitman Bros. continues to produce all its shirts in its Ashland, Pennsylvania factory.

name: Bondhus
summary: Leading manufacturer of high-quality Allen wrenches and hex tools.
verdict: All tools are produced in their Monticello, Minnesota facility, maintaining a strong commitment to American manufacturing.

name: Wilde Tool
summary: A full line of professional-grade hand tools including pliers, screwdrivers, and pry bars.
verdict: Wilde Tool is proud to manufacture all of its products in Hiawatha, Kansas, since its founding.

name: Wright Tool
summary: Manufactures a broad line of high-quality, heavy-duty hand tools for the industrial market.
verdict: All Wright tools are designed and manufactured in Barberton, Ohio, with a focus on American steel and labor.

name: Tekton
summary: A new-era tool company actively increasing its US production of pliers, drivers, and wrenches.
verdict: Tekton is praised for its transparency and for bringing more manufacturing back to the US, though some components are still globally sourced.

name: Klein Tools
summary: A dominant brand for electricians, offering a wide range of hand tools and equipment.
verdict: While historically a US-made brand, Klein now operates a global supply chain. Many of their core products are still made in US factories, but others are sourced from overseas.

name: Marshalltown
summary: Premier tool manufacturer for construction, especially masonry and drywall.
verdict: Marshalltown has been manufacturing tools in Marshalltown, Iowa for over a century and remains a top name in the industry.

name: Lucchese Bootmaker
summary: Legendary Texas-based company crafting high-end western boots since 1883.
verdict: Lucchese boots are handmade in El Paso, Texas, representing the pinnacle of American bootmaking craftsmanship.

name: Mystery Ranch
summary: Builds high-quality, durable backpacks for military, firefighting, and mountaineering use.
verdict: While they have international production, their high-end packs and custom work are still proudly built in Bozeman, Montana.

name: Oomingmak
summary: A cooperative of Native Alaskan women who hand-knit garments from Qiviut, the soft under-wool of the musk ox.
verdict: A truly unique Alaskan enterprise, supporting native craftspeople and traditions. All items are hand-knitted by members across Alaska.

name: Boll & Branch
summary: Sells luxury bedding, sheets, and towels made from organic cotton with a transparent supply chain.
verdict: While raw materials are sourced globally, Boll & Branch is a US-owned company with a strong commitment to ethical production.

name: West Paw
summary: Creates eco-friendly and durable dog toys, beds, and treats with a focus on sustainability.
verdict: All West Paw products are proudly manufactured in Bozeman, Montana. They are a certified B Corp.
